response_requirements.initial_response_description: No specific statutory deadline; agencies must respond within 'reasonable period' based on good faith effort
response_requirements.final_response_notes: Florida law does not set specific response timeframes. Reasonable period varies depending on type and circumstances of request
response_requirements.extension_notes: No formal extension mechanism; reasonableness determined case-by-case
response_requirements.good_faith_standard: Agencies must make good faith effort to respond promptly and locate records

fee_structure.search_fee: May charge for extensive research or technology use
fee_structure.search_fee_notes: Allowed for extensive research, must be reasonable
fee_structure.copy_fee_notes: Up to $0.15 per one-sided copy for standard documents
fee_structure.electronic_fee: Electronic access should be provided when feasible to reduce costs
fee_structure.fee_waiver_notes: No statutory fee waiver provision; all fees must be reasonable
fee_structure.reasonableness_standard: All fees must be reasonable and not used to discourage requests

exemptions.description: Criminal investigation information and active criminal intelligence
Personal identifying information including social security numbers, bank account numbers, credit card information
Security system plans, vulnerability assessments, and security information
Certain personnel information including home addresses, telephone numbers, photographs, and social security numbers of employees
Identity of victims of crimes, particularly sexual offenses and child abuse
Trade secrets as defined in Florida law

appeal_process.first_level: No formal administrative appeal; Attorney General mediation services available
appeal_process.first_level_notes: Florida has no statutory administrative appeals process. Attorney General offers voluntary mediation services
appeal_process.second_level: Circuit Court - Civil lawsuit (mandamus, declaratory judgment)
appeal_process.second_level_deadline_notes: No specific statutory deadline for filing court action
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Court may award reasonable attorney fees to substantially prevailing party

requester_requirements.purpose_notes: No requirement to state purpose or provide identification
requester_requirements.request_format_notes: Phone, written, or in-person requests accepted; no specific form required
requester_requirements.specific_format: Request must reasonably identify records sought
requester_requirements.constitutional_right: Article I, Section 24 of Florida Constitution establishes right of access to public records

agency_obligations.records_officer_title: Public Records Custodian (designated by each agency)
agency_obligations.business_hours_notes: Agencies must permit inspection under reasonable conditions
agency_obligations.response_format_options: Electronic access should be provided when feasible
agency_obligations.redaction_requirements: Redact exempt portions only; must state specific exemption basis
agency_obligations.liberal_interpretation: Law must be liberally interpreted to favor disclosure

oversight_body.name: Florida Attorney General (mediation services)
oversight_body.role: Provides voluntary mediation services for public records disputes
oversight_body.contact_info: Office of the Attorney General, The Capitol PL-01, Tallahassee, FL 32399-1050

official_resources.request_portal_notes: Many agencies maintain their own online portals

validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields verified from official Florida Statutes. Florida has NO specific statutory deadline - uses 'reasonable time' standard based on good faith effort (response_time=-1 indicates no fixed deadline). Copying fees up to $0.15 per one-sided page. No administrative appeal process - enforcement primarily through civil lawsuits with attorney fees available. Constitutional right to access established in Article I, Section 24.
unique_characteristics: No specific response deadline (reasonable time standard)
